meanings.definition: To remove the roof from (a building)
meanings.sent1: The workers unroofed the old house to repair the structure.
meanings.sent2: The storm unroofed several buildings in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids decided to unroof their treehouse for a better view.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected tornado unroofed the town, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The decision to unroof the building revealed a beautiful starry sky above.

meanings.definition: Having no roof or a roof that has been removed
meanings.sent1: The unroofed barn provided shelter for the animals during the sunny day.
meanings.sent2: The unroofed gazebo allowed the guests to enjoy the open air during the event.
meanings.sent3: The unroofed cabin looked like a giant birdhouse in the middle of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The unroofed castle stood majestically against the backdrop of the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The unroofed stadium offered a unique experience for the spectators under the clear sky.
